Name: KFN Lower Saxony School Survey
Source: KFN (Kriminologisches Forschungsinstitut Niedersachsen E.V. (Criminological Research Institute of Lower Saxony E.V.))
Variables: Youth violence in victim and perpetrator perspectives, other deviant behaviour (e.g. truancy), extremism, bullying, risk and protective factors (e.g. parenting styles, personality factors)
Comments: not clear how to acces data, request needed

Name: Sozio-oekonomisches Panel (SOEP), SOEP-Core v37eu
Source: Research Data Center SOEP (German Institute for Economic Research (DIW Berlin))
Variables: well-being, household demography, population, education, qualification, occupation and employment, earnings, houseing, rent, physical health, mental health, attitudes, values, personality, migration, integration, wealth, neighborhood, family, networks
Access: on request, special request for regional data

Name: LSN-Online Datenbank
Source: LSN - Landesamt für Statistik Niedersachsen (Federal Institute for Statistics Lower Saxony)
Variables: Themes include: Life & Work, State & Society, Economy & Prices, Environment & Mobility

Name: pairfam - Beziehungs- und Familienpanel (English: Panel Analysis of Intimate Relationships and Family Dynamics)
Source: pairfam - Beziehungs- und Familienpanel (English: Panel Analysis of Intimate Relationships and Family Dynamics)
Variables: depends on wave (more than 2000)
Access: on request, special request for regional data
Comments: since 2022 FReDA, regional data only on special internal workplaces

Name: pairfam - COVID-19 Studie (COVID-19 Study)
Source: pairfam - Beziehungs- und Familienpanel (English: Panel Analysis of Intimate Relationships and Family Dynamics)
Variables: Identification variables, household composition, current COVID-19 situation, Current employment and vocational training (anchor, partner), changes due to COVID-19 in employment or vocational situation (anchor, partner), well-being variables past 4 weeks (anger, stressm anxiety, concern, loneliness, worries), partnership variables ((contact freq, quality (intimacy, esteem, conflict), satisfaction, division of labor), family climate, child care arrangement, external biological parent/child not living with anchor (and child), Parental role (feelings of competence, unspecific strain, children: Screen time, Children: Home schooling, Respondents up to 25 years (depressiveness, coping, risktaking, screen time, home schooling), conclusion/opinions
Access: on request, special request for regional data
Comments: regional data only on special internal workplaces

Name: ALLBUS - Allgemeine Bevölkerungsumfrage der Sozialwissenschaften (General social scientific population survey)
Geographical Unit: Federal State (option for several indicators for regional data)
Variables: questionnaire blocks: deviant behaviour and sanction, work and occupation, demography, ethnocentrism and minorities, family, health, households and social relationships, lifestyle and personality, politics, regional data, religion and worldview, social networks and social capital, social inequality, technical data, paradata, interviewer data, values, attitudes and perception of economics, living and environment
Access: open access, special request for regional data

Name: INKAR
Source: Bundesinstitut für Bau-, Stadt- und Raumforschung (English: Federal Institute for Construction, Urban and Spatial Research)
Variables: over 600 indicators on education, demography, job market, economy, living, transport, environment and others

Name: Pupils enrolled in early childhood education by sex and NUTS2 regions
Variables: Pupils enrolled in early childhood education (pre-primary education, early childhood education or early childhood educational development)
Comments: More variables on education can be found on https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/data/database, follow the order: General and regional statistics > Region statistics by NUTS > Regional education statistics - ISCED 2011

Name: Gross domestic product (GDP) at current market prices by NUTS 3 regions
Variables: Various measures of regional Gross Domestic Product (in Euros).
Comments: More variables on education can be found on https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/data/database, follow the order: General and regional statistics > Regional economic accounts > Gross dometic product indicators (reg_eco10gdp) OR Branch and household accounts (reg_eco1-brch)

Name: EU labour force survey
Variables: Age, income, labour status etc...
Comments: up to 8 weeks to get data

Name: Leefbarometer
Source: Ministerie van Binnenlandse Zaken en Koninkrijksrelaties (Rijk)
Geographical Unit: Liveability for rasters of 100m*100m  (neigbourhood-level then I suppose)
Study Period: Reoccuring dataset (done in 2002, 2008, 2012, 2016, 2014-2020 and 2018-2020. The URL is for the 2021 one.
Variables: Number of houses, physical environment, services, social cohesion, nuisance and safety.
Data Quality/ Limitations: I cannot determine that for this dataset.
Comments: Geographical data, format: XML/RDF

Name: Recipients of social benefits (Uitkeringen gemeente Groningen)
Variables: The number of people in Groningen (the municipaliy) receiving benefits, divided per type (e.g. unemployment).
Secondary or primary data: Hard to say; as they collaborate with the UWV potentially a combination of both?
Data Quality/ Limitations: You can download an excel-file, which appears to be of decent quality.
Comments: Data in Dutch.The excel-file is rather small, but it does contain a nice overview.

Name: Social contacts in Groningen (In Dutch: Sociale contacten gemeente Groningen)
Variables: The percentage of Groningen citizens who feel like they have sufficient social contacts by type of contact (e.g. family member etc.).
Secondary or primary data: Collected by OIS Groningen with a "neighbourhood survey", so secundary.
Data Quality/ Limitations: There appears to be no dataset to download.
Comments: It appears that only a limited part of the data is visible (you cannot download an excel file like you can with the benefits-data). Data in Dutch

Name: Students in secundary education (In Dutch: Leerlingen voortgezet onderwijs naar school en woonlocatie leerling, gemeente Groningen)
Geographical Unit: Per school within the municipality of Groningen.
Time Unit: There is no time-dimension visible in the excel-file, so it likely corresponds to the schoolyear.
Variables: The number of students in secundary education per school and municipality of residence of the student.
Secondary or primary data: Secundary. The data are collected by DUO and are modified by OIS Groningen. They filtered the Groningen data from the dataset which covered all of the Netherlands.
Data Quality/ Limitations: The data is not structured in the most efficient way, but nonetheless potentially interesting for our inventory (particularly for the contextual factors).
Comments: Data in Dutch. Oftentimes there is the value 0 in the dataset, but if someone would structure it differentlu, it could be very informative.

Name: Inhabitants of Groningen by place of origin (In Dutch: Bevolking naar herkomst per gebied binnen de gemeente Groningen)
Variables: Place of origin of Groning's residents (divided into migrants and children of migrants)
Data Quality/ Limitations: There appears to be no dataset to download.
Comments: The acces here also seems limited (you cannot download an excel-file).

Name: Population municipality of Groningen (In Dutch: Bevolking naar herkomst per gebied binnen de gemeente Groningen)
Variables: Several characteristics, such as age, gender and marital status.
Data Quality/ Limitations: There appears to be no dataset to download.
Comments: The acces here also seems limited (you cannot download an excel-file).

Name: Crime reports (In Dutch: Aangiften politie per buurt gemeente Groningen)
Variables: It distinguishes between 5 types of theft (i.e. from car/house/company, of car/bicycle), abuse and destruction of property. This is measured per neighbourhood within the municipality.
Secondary or primary data: Secundary. The municipality of Groningen owns the data, but it is collected by Groningen's police force and modified by OIS Groningen.
Data Quality/ Limitations: The data contains relatively many 0 values, but the excel file still seems very relevant to our inventory.
Comments: Data in Dutch

Name: Dropouts in highschool of vulnerable youth (In Dutch: Voortijdige schoolverlaters)
Variables: The data are separated by gender. It gives the number of students, the number of dropouts and the corresponding dropout-percentage.
Secondary or primary data: This remains a bit unclear, as there is no notion of the source of the data.
Contact Details: Not very intuitive way to view the data.
Data Quality/ Limitations: At first I overlooked it, but by clicking on the excel-icon, data can be exported into an excel-file.
Comments: Data only in Dutch

Name: Criminal Charges Pressed in Groningen. (In Dutch: Aangiften politie gemeente Groningen)
Variables: theft (various types), robbery, assault/violence etc..
Data Quality/ Limitations: No missing obvervations for the study period
Comments: Data only available in Dutch

Name: Number of social benefits (unemployment etc..) (In Dutch: Uitkeringen gemeente Groningen)
Variables: IOAW/Z, ROA, WW, WAO etc..
Comments: Data for unemployment benefits only available for 2014-2020, data for disability benefit recipients only available for 2014-2020

Name: Background Variables Districts and Neighbourhoods (In Dutch: Kerncijfers wijken en buurten yyyy)
Variables: Demographic (number of inhabitants, gender etc...), Number of Businesses by category etc...
Comments: Only available in Dutch

Name: Background Variables Regional Statistics (In Dutch: Regionale kerncijfers Nederland)
Geographical Unit: All Dutch: NUTS 1 (Northern Netherlands), Provinces; COROP regions (NUTS 3), Municipalities
Variables: Demographic etc.. (see ID;3)
Comments: Note that muncipal borders and well as NUTS3 (COROP) definitions might have changed over time

Name: Netherlands Business survey, region, month
Variables: Turnover, Orders, Workforce, Economic Climate, etc....
Data Quality/ Limitations: Missing observations in some cases (industry aggregates)
Comments: Uses SBI 2008 definitions of business activities (sectors)

Name: Land use; all categories, municipalities
Geographical Unit: Regions (NUTS1), Provinces (NUTS2), COROP-Regions (NUTS3), Municipalities, Urban Regions, Metropolitain agglomerations
Variables: Total surface area per type of use
Data Quality/ Limitations: Data for urban regions seem to be missing
Comments: Only available for specific years

Name: Proximity to facilities; distances by car, regional
Variables: Distance to ''Activity/Amenity" and Number of "Activities/Amenities" within "x" km
Data Quality/ Limitations: Missing observations for some categories (either not included yet or discontinued such as distance to Physiotherapist)

Name: Energy consumption private dwellings; type of dwelling and regions
Geographical Unit: Regions (NUTS1), Provinces (NUTS2), Regional Energy Statergy Regions, SubRES, Municipalities,
Number of cases: 1 number per year per period per dwelling type
Variables: Average consumption on natural gas (m3), average consumption of electricity (kWh), district heating (%)
Data Quality/ Limitations: Frequent missing observations for district heating (%)
Comments: Provisional data for 2018 onwards as of 07-05-2023

Name: Municipal budgets; income and expenditures by region and size class
Number of cases: 1 number per year per region per category
Variables: Expenses on municipal tasks ''Task Type" in million euros
Comments: Budget for 2023 (not actual expenses)

Name: Municipal budgets; levies per municipality
Variables: Municipal taxed in 1000 euros, per type:
Comments: Some municipalities merged in the study period, Projections for 2023

Name: Existing own homes; average purchase prices, region
Variables: Average purchasing price owned homes

Name: Housing satisfaction; household characteristics, regions
Number of cases: 1 number per year per period per type of dwelling
Variables: Satisfaction with current dwelling, satisfaction with living environment

Name: Construction; category of purpose of new buildings, building phase, region
Variables: Order received, Building projects started, Production of building projects, Building projects completed (all in mln euros)

Name: Regional Monitor Cromprehensive Wellbeing 2022 (In Dutch: Regionale Monitor Brede Welvaart 2022)
Variables: Subjective Wellbeing (0-100) , Greenhouse gas emission per capita etc. See overview of indicators used https://www.cbs.nl/nl-nl/visualisaties/regionale-monitor-brede-welvaart/beschrijving-indicatoren
Agggregated/Individual Data: aggregate (but also at municipal level, which are
Comments: Contains information on all variables. For further information see the data link and tab (In Dutch only) "Technische toelichting" & Beschrijving indicatoren

Name: Repeating of class, highschool (in Dutch: Zittenblijvers middelbaar onderwijs)
Geographical Unit: Country wide, province (NUTS2), and per school location
Number of cases: 1 per area (or school) of observations (might be non-constant across time for school locations)
Variables: Number of class repeaters, number of pupils going down a grade level, number of pupils going up a grade level.
Agggregated/Individual Data: aggregate (one number per school per year)
Contact Details: Not very intuitive way to view the get in contact with DUO
Comments: Multiple datasets (waves) available, one per school year

Name: Werkloosheids Wet Data (Unemployment benefits Data)
Geographical Unit: Province (NUTS2), Labour Market Region (Arbeidsmarkregio), and Municipality
Variables: UB entrants, UB recipients, UB exit
Comments: Only available in Dutch. Labour market regions. See https://www.werk.nl/arbeidsmarktinformatie/regio for an overview

Name: Labour market tightness indicator (In Dutch: Spanningsindicator Data)
Variables: Labour market tightness indicator
Data Quality/ Limitations: Missing observations for some sectors and employment type (could be that these sectors are unrepresented in local labour markets)
Comments: Explanation of indicator calculation: https://www.werk.nl/imagesdxa/uitleg_methodiek_spanningsindicator_arbeidsmarkt_tcm95-425144.pdf (IN DUTCH ONLY!)

Name: Number of registered job-seekers at the UWV with and without employment (In Dutch: Het aantal Geregistreerde Werkzoekenden bij UWV met en/of zonder dienstverband (GWU))
Variables: GWU with employment and GWU without employment
Comments: Persons can be included/excluded based on the type of social benefits (unemployment, disability etc).

Name: Vacancies data (In Dutch: Vacaturemarkt Data)
Variables: Vacancies created, open vacancies
Comments: Only available in Dutch. Labour market regions. See https://www.werk.nl/arbeidsmarktinformatie/regio for an overview

Name: Online vacancies data (In Dutch: Online vacatures data)
Variables: Open online vacancies
Comments: Only available in Dutch. Labour market regions. See https://www.werk.nl/arbeidsmarktinformatie/regio for an overview

Name: [OPEN ACCESS] Businesses and employed persons (In Dutch: Vestigingen en werkzame personen)
Variables: number of businesses and employed persons
Comments: Note that on the municipal level data is only available for 2018-2022 and by. For other geographical areas information similar years apply but selection can also be made on the basis of sector and business size (number of employees).

Name: [PRIVATE DATA] Businesses and employed persons (in Dutch: Vestigingen en werkzame personen)
Geographical Unit: Countrywide, small geographical area "postcode" (Zipcode to 4 digits) or per business
Variables: number of businesses (by size), employed persons, value added,
Agggregated/Individual Data: aggregate (per postal code) or individual (per business)
Comments: Data in Dutch, more information on pricing see: https://www.lisa.nl/data/tarieven. There are two different options available.

Name: Population on Jan 1st and on average by sex, age and region (In Dutch: Bevolking op 1 junuari gemiddeld per geslacht, leeftijd en regio)
Geographical Unit: From larger regions, to COROP and municipalities.
Variables: Population counts on January 1st and on average, in which you can specify marital status, gender and age (besides the region).
Comments: Only in Dutch. Plus, I discovered during my thesis that for the average population, CBS takes only half of the people of age 0.

Name: Graduates; age, education type, ethnic background, and region (In Dutch; Gediplomeerden; leeftijd, onderwijssoort, migratieachtergrond, woonregio)
Geographical Unit: From larger regions, to COROP and municipalities.
Variables: The number of graduates, in which one can specify age, education type (e.g. secundary and multiple types of tertiaty education), ethnic background and region.
Comments: Only in Dutch. Furthermore, for migration background, there are not many categories.

Name: Employment history over the past 4 years (in Dutch: Arbeidsverleden bevolking afgelopen 4 jaar, regio(indeling 2021), 2004-2020)
Geographical Unit: From larger regions, to COROP and municipalities.
Time Unit: The amount of time of being employed goes from 1 month-1year, 1-2 years, 2-3 years, >3 or 4.
Variables: The number of people, the number of people being employed & unemployed per time-element (as specified two columns to the left). One can also filter on sex, age and ethnic background.
Comments: Only available in Dutch.

Name: Household wealth; by household characteristics, per region (2022 definition) (In Dutch: Vermogen van huishoudens; huishoudenskenmerken, regio (indeling 2022))
Geographical Unit: NUTS3, Province (NUTS2), COROP (NUTS1), Municipalities, labour market regions
Variables: Number of households (by type in thousands),  total wealh, average wealth (thousands), median wealth
Comments: Data is only available in Dutch

Name: Domestic violence (In Dutch: Huiselijk geweld; kerncijfers Veilig Thuis, regio)
Geographical Unit: Provinces/COROP/"Veilig Thuis regio's" (Safe at Home regions).
Variables: Activities of the organisation "Veilig Thuis" (e.g. number reports/number of resolved and running cases).
Secondary or primary data: CBS received the data from "Veilig Thuis", I am not sure to what extent the data were already piled together.
Comments: Only available in Dutch, because of the vulnerable population, there is not much additional information available.

Name: Socio-economic status; scores per district or neighbourhood (In Dutch: Sociaal-economische status; scores per wijk en buurt, regio-indeling 2021)
Variables: average SES-WOA scores and mean abosolute differences.
Comments: Data is only in Dutch. Note that the Dutch Wijk (District) is bigger than Buurt (Neighbourhood), which is a part of a Wijk. A definition of SES-WOA score is only provided in Dutch, but looks at wealth, education and long-term employment. https://www.cbs.nl/nl-nl/faq/infoservice/hoe-interpreteer-je-de-ses-woa-scores-en-hoe-zijn-deze-bepaald-

Name: Emission Registration (In Dutch; Emissie Registratie)
Geographical Unit: Netherlands, provinces, municipalities, fluvial areas, water management areas, water closure unit, 5*5 km2 areas.
Variables: Emission of substances (ammonia etc, pesticides) in air, surface water, sewage systems, or soil. Cna be categorised by sector, subsector, emission cause, or even company
Comments: Data only available in Dutch.

Name: Groningen Panel (In Dutch: Groningener Panel)
Source: Social Planning Bureau Groningen (In Dutch: sociaal planbureau groningen) (CMO-STAMM)
Time Unit: depends on topic (10 times a year)
Variables: Topics: Earthquakes, health, education, broad welfare, youth, labour market.
Comments: Only a selection of indicators, on a given theme, can be obtained on request.Data only available in Dutch. Note, that some data comes from the CBS (aggregate level; municipality)

Name: Drenthe Panel (In Dutch; Drents Panel)
Source: Drenthe Trending Bureau (In Dutch: drents trendbureau) (CMO-STAMM)
Time Unit: depends on topic (10 times a year)
Variables: Topics; poverty, broad welfare, illiteracy, education, health, covid....
Comments: Only a selection of indicators, on a given theme, can be obtained on request.Data only available in Dutch. Note that there has been a previous panel called Drents parlement since 2005 which ended in 2020. Note, that some data comes from the CBS (aggregate level; municipality).

Name: Persons at risk of poverty or social exclusion by NUTS regions - EU 2020 strategy
Variables: Persons at risk of poverty or social exclusion
Comments: Not all countries are included from the start (2003). Additional dataset on other social exclusion indicators see: https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/data/database and look for; General and regional statistics > Regional statistics by NUTS classification > Regional poverty and social exclusion statistics

Name: Youth in youth services/youth care (In Dutch: Kerncijfers over jeugdzorg, 2015-2020)
Variables: The number of youth in youthcare (per region), the youthcare trajectories, and the types of care.
Comments: Only in Dutch and there is quite some missing data on the youthcare trajectories.

Name: Municipal expenses for youthcare (In Dutch: Gemeentelijke kosten; jeugdzorg, regio)
Variables: The type of youthcare, prospective- and actual expenses. These can be specified in "raw" numbers or per thousand of the population.
Secondary or primary data: I assume primary; CBS got the data from municipalities that filled in the questionaire "Enquête Kosten Wmo en Jeugd" (but CBS gathered the data)
Data Quality/ Limitations: Missing observations for some categories (could be that no expenses are made).
Comments: It is only in Dutch and empty cells are quite frequent (which is a good case ofc, but not for research necessarily). Data likely available since 2015 because municipalities became responsible for youthcare.

Name: Grenzdaten (Border Data)
Study Location: Netherlands, Lower Saxony, North-Rhine Westphalia and Belgium
Variables: Data on employment, enterprises, population, commuting and economy
Data Quality/ Limitations: Missing cases in some variables on NUTS 2 or 3 level

Name: Datenbank Beschäftigung (Employment database)
Number of cases: should be all of the 401 districts in NUTS 3 classification
Variables: demographic and employment data
Comments: Webbased, but with downloadable tables

Name: Offene Daten Stadt Oldenburg
Variables: 43 variables on culture, leisure, sports, tourism, transport, administration, population, geodata, infrastructure, living, social data, economy, employment, education, science, law and health
Contact Details: digitalisierung@stadt-oldenburg.de; and via contact formular under https://opendata.oldenburg.de/daten/anfragen

Name: Regionaldatenbank Deutschland (Regional Database Germany)
Source: Statistische Ämter des Bundes und der Länder (Statistical Offices of the Federation and the Länder)
Variables: Data on following themes: 1: region, population, job market, elections; 2: education, social security, health, judicature; 3: Living, environment; 4: economy; 5: trade, enterprises, skilled crafts and trade; 6: prices, income, wages, consumption; 7: public finances, taxes, personnel; 8: total account of federal states (national economy, health economy); 9: others
Comments: Same categories as GENESIS by DESTATIS, different variables

Name: GENESIS-Online
Variables: Data on following themes: 1: region, population, job market, elections; 2: education, social security, health, judicature; 3: Living, environment; 4: economy; 5: trade, enterprises, skilled crafts and trade; 6: prices, income, wages, consumption; 7: public finances, taxes, personnel; 8: total account of federal states (national economy, health economy); 9: others
Comments: Same categories as GENESIS by DESTATIS, different variables

Name: Statistische gegevens per vierkant 2021-2020-2019 (Statistical data per square 2021-2020-2019)
Variables: data on demography, housing energy, social security, density, proximity of facilities
Comments: didn't find the dataset

Name: Geodaten Landkreis Leer (Geodata of the district Leer)
Variables: fibreglass, retirements homes, swimming spots, urban land-use planing, emergency services, administrative points, aerial images, conservation, satelite images, schools, solar, charging stations, water protection,

Name: Zensus 2011 (National census 2011)
Number of cases: 11339 municipalities, 412 districts, 16 federal states, and state level
Variables: Data on population, education, employment. migration, buidlings, dwellings, households, families

Name: Zensusatlas 2011 - Bundesweite kleinräumige Daten (1km²-Raster) der amtichen Statistik zur Bevölkerung, Gebäude und Wohnungen (census atlas 2011 - Nationwide small-scale data (1km² grid) of official statistics on population, buildings and dwellings)
Variables: Share of under 18-year olds, share of over 65-year olds, average household size, vacancy rate, average age, population, living space per flat, sex ratio, living space per resident

Name: Regionalatlas (Regional Atlas Germany)
Source: Statistische Ämter des Bundes und der Länder (Statistical Offices of the Federation and the Länder)
Variables: see Regionaldatenbank Deutschland (56)
Comments: GeoJSON and Shapefile formats, pretty sure thats just data from Regionaldatenbank Deutschland as geographic data

Name: Eurostat Regional Yearbook
Variables: Themes: population, health, education, labour market, living conditions, digital society, economy, business, research and development, tourism, transport, environment, agriculture
Comments: Martin already included some variables individually in the spreadsheet

Name: Einwohner (Inhabitants) - MORO Project (Modellvorhaben der Raumordnung (Model project of spatial planning)
Source: Bundesinstitut für Bau-, Stadt- und Raumforschung (BBSR) - (Federal Institute for Research on Building, Urban Affairs and Spatial Development)
Variables: Number of inhabitants, share of women, share of men, population density

Source: Bundesinstitut für Bau-, Stadt- und Raumforschung (BBSR) - (Federal Institute for Research on Building, Urban Affairs and Spatial Development)
Variables: Population < 6 y., Population6 to < 18 y., Population 25 to < 50 y., Population 50 < 65 y., Population 65 to < 75 y., Population 75 y. and older, Average age, Old-age dependency ratio

Source: Bundesinstitut für Bau-, Stadt- und Raumforschung (BBSR) - (Federal Institute for Research on Building, Urban Affairs and Spatial Development)
Variables: Number of foreigners, Female foreigners, Male foreigners, German nationals, Proportion of Germans (no data for Germany, but for the Netherlands)

Source: Bundesinstitut für Bau-, Stadt- und Raumforschung (BBSR) - (Federal Institute for Research on Building, Urban Affairs and Spatial Development)
Variables: Live births, deaths, natural balance

Source: Bundesinstitut für Bau-, Stadt- und Raumforschung (BBSR) - (Federal Institute for Research on Building, Urban Affairs and Spatial Development)
Variables: In-migration, out-migration, net migration, net migration < 18 y., net migration 18 < 50 y., net migration 25 < 50 y., net migration 50 < 60 y., net migration 65+ y.

Source: Bundesinstitut für Bau-, Stadt- und Raumforschung (BBSR) - (Federal Institute for Research on Building, Urban Affairs and Spatial Development)

Source: Bundesinstitut für Bau-, Stadt- und Raumforschung (BBSR) - (Federal Institute for Research on Building, Urban Affairs and Spatial Development)
